statements.name: PROC LOCALEDATA
statements.description: Specifies the source of customized locale data.

statements.name: LOAD
statements.description: Specifies which source of locale data is loaded for customization.

arguments.name: SASLOCALE
arguments.description: loads the locale data from the factory setting default locale database.

arguments.name: REGISTRY
arguments.description: loads the locale data from the SAS registry. This locale data could be customized locale data that has been stored in the SAS registry.

statements.name: MODIFY
statements.description: Customizes the locale data by locale element key or by locale category.

arguments.name: category=
arguments.description:
customizes all locale elements in a category. You can select one of the following categories:
• LC_NUMERIC
• LC_MONETARY
• LC_TIME

statements.name: CONTENTS
statements.description: Displays the value of the specified locale element key.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: displays the value of all locale element keys.

arguments.name: locale-element-key
arguments.description: displays the value of the specified locale element key.

arguments.name: category-name
arguments.description: displays the value of locale elements for the specified category.

statements.name: SAVE
statements.description: Stores the customized locale data in the SAS registry.

arguments.name: REGISTRY
arguments.description: stores locale data in the Sasuser library and registers it in the SAS registry. The encoding of the stored locale data is in UNICODE escape. Here is the hierarchy of the saved locale element in the SAS registry: SAS_REGISTRYLOCALEsas localelocale element key locale categorylocale element key.

arguments.name: key-name
arguments.description: saves the specified locale element key name and value.

arguments.name: category-name
arguments.description: saves all elements in the specified category.
